reasoning: The critique targets the multiplicative “product of factors” toy model in §2.4 (uniform, independent factors) and notes that independence/uniformity assumptions are highly sensitive and may fail under correlation or non-uniform risk. That point is largely correct, but it only partially connects to the essay’s main conclusion (“no easy eutopia”), which is also supported by many non-model considerations (historical moral catastrophe examples; long §3 discussion of bounded/unbounded value functions and ‘fussiness’). Even within §2.4 the authors frame the model as illustrative/toy, so pointing out unrealistic assumptions weakens its evidential force but doesn’t strongly refute the broader fragility claim. The critique is clear, focused, and has little extraneous material, but it overstates how much this single modeling choice underwrites the essay’s ‘far-reaching conclusions’.
title: Correlated factors and non-uniform distributions undermine the multiplicative rarity model
